headline: Warner Bros reopens takeover talks with Paramount after receiving waiver from Netflix
summary: Netflix is granting Warner Bros. Discovery a seven-day waiver allowing the studio to reopen takeover talks with Paramount Skydance.  Warner Bros. said in a regulatory filing Tuesday that the waiver will allow it to discuss unresolved “deficiencies” in Paramount's previous offers.  Warner Bros. now has until Feb. 23 to negotiate a possible transaction with Paramount Skydance.

content.title: Warner Bros reopens takeover talks with Paramount after receiving waiver from Netflix
content.summary: Netflix is granting Warner Bros. Discovery a seven-day waiver allowing the studio to reopen takeover talks with Paramount Skydance.  Warner Bros. said in a regulatory filing Tuesday that the waiver will allow it to discuss unresolved “deficiencies” in Paramount's previous offers.  Warner Bros. now has until Feb. 23 to negotiate a possible transaction with Paramount Skydance.

headline: Warner Bros. Reopens Deal Talks After Paramount Raises Bid
summary: Warner Bros. negotiated a waiver with the streaming giant that will allow it to engage with Paramount for seven days about the terms of its most recent offer, according to a statement Tuesday.  The decision came after a Paramount banker told a Warner Bros. board member that Paramount would offer at least $31 a share if the company agreed to reopen talks.

content.title: Warner Bros. Reopens Deal Talks After Paramount Raises Bid
content.summary: Warner Bros. negotiated a waiver with the streaming giant that will allow it to engage with Paramount for seven days about the terms of its most recent offer, according to a statement Tuesday.  The decision came after a Paramount banker told a Warner Bros. board member that Paramount would offer at least $31 a share if the company agreed to reopen talks.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery backs Netflix merger while reopening Paramount talks
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery wants to hear Paramount’s “best and final proposal” for the media company, and is opening a brief window for discussions about a bid, while also moving forward with its Netflix merger and urging shareholders to reject Paramount’s current hostile bid.

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery backs Netflix merger while reopening Paramount talks
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery wants to hear Paramount’s “best and final proposal” for the media company, and is opening a brief window for discussions about a bid, while also moving forward with its Netflix merger and urging shareholders to reject Paramount’s current hostile bid.

thumbnail.caption: Aerial and street views of the Paramount building in Hollywood, Los Angeles, on December 11, 2025. - Robert Gauthier/Los Angeles Times/Getty Images

headline: Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised offer, but gives studio a week to negotiate better deal
summary: Warner Bros Discovery has rejected Paramount Skydance's latest $30-a-share hostile takeover bid, but is giving the Hollywood studio seven days to see if it can come up with a better deal to buy the owner of HBO Max and the "Harry Potter" franchise, Warner Bros said in a statement.  Paramount informally broached an ‌even higher share price, $31 a share, Warner Bros said, apparently enticing the board to the table.  The rival bidder now has until February 23 to submit its "best and final offer," which Netflix ‌is allowed to match under the terms of the merger agreement, Warner Bros said on Tuesday.

content.title: Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised offer, but gives studio a week to negotiate better deal
content.summary: Warner Bros Discovery has rejected Paramount Skydance's latest $30-a-share hostile takeover bid, but is giving the Hollywood studio seven days to see if it can come up with a better deal to buy the owner of HBO Max and the "Harry Potter" franchise, Warner Bros said in a statement.  Paramount informally broached an ‌even higher share price, $31 a share, Warner Bros said, apparently enticing the board to the table.  The rival bidder now has until February 23 to submit its "best and final offer," which Netflix ‌is allowed to match under the terms of the merger agreement, Warner Bros said on Tuesday.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Sets Special Meeting Date of March 20, 2026, and Unanimously Recommends Shareholders Vote FOR Netflix Merger; Warner Bros. Discovery to Initiate Discussions with Paramount Skydance for Their Best and Final Offer
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced that it will hold the Special Meeting of Shareholders (the "Special Meeting") to vote on the merger with Netflix, Inc. ("Netflix") (NASDAQ: NFLX) on March 20, 2026 at 8:00 a.m. Eastern Time and the commencement of mailing of the definitive proxy statement to shareholders in connection with the Special Meeting. WBD also announced today that Netflix has provided WBD a limited waiver under the terms of WBD's merger agreement with Ne

headline: Warner Bros reopens Paramount talks, Tripadvisor to revamp board
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman takes a look at some of Tuesday morning's trending tickers and stories. Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) is set to reopen acquisition discussions with Paramount (PSKY), potentially reigniting another bidding war with Netflix (NFLX). Tripadvisor's (TRIP) board will reportedly be overhauled by activist investor Starboard (SVACW), according to the Wall Street Journal. Medical-device maker Masimo (MASI) will reportedly be acquired by life sciences company Danaher (DHR) for $9.9 billion, according to the Financial Times. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Warner Bros reopens Paramount talks, Tripadvisor to revamp board
content.description:
Morning Brief host Julie Hyman takes a look at some of Tuesday morning's trending tickers and stories.

Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) is set to reopen acquisition discussions with Paramount (PSKY), potentially reigniting another bidding war with Netflix (NFLX).

Tripadvisor's (TRIP) board will reportedly be overhauled by activist investor Starboard (SVACW), according to the Wall Street Journal.

Medical-device maker Masimo (MASI) will reportedly be acquired by life sciences company Danaher (DHR) for $9.9 billion, according to the Financial Times.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman takes a look at some of Tuesday morning's trending tickers and stories. Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) is set to reopen acquisition discussions with Paramount (PSKY), potentially reigniting another bidding war with Netflix (NFLX). Tripadvisor's (TRIP) board will reportedly be overhauled by activist investor Starboard (SVACW), according to the Wall Street Journal. Medical-device maker Masimo (MASI) will reportedly be acquired by life sciences company Danaher (DHR) for $9.9 billion, according to the Financial Times. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Warner Bros restarts talks with Paramount Skydance amid takeover battle
summary: Bosses at Warner Bros are continuing to tell shareholders to back the Netflix offer valuing the business at around £61.2bn.

content.title: Warner Bros restarts talks with Paramount Skydance amid takeover battle
content.summary: Bosses at Warner Bros are continuing to tell shareholders to back the Netflix offer valuing the business at around £61.2bn.

headline: Warner Bros. Reopens Talks as Paramount Signals Higher Bid
summary: Netflix, which Warner Bros. still described as its preferred bidder, has granted the board seven days to discuss Paramount’s most recent proposal, according to a statement Tuesday.  The decision came after a Paramount banker told a Warner Bros. board member that Paramount would offer at least $31 a share, or $1 a share higher than its previous offer, if the company agreed to reopen talks.

content.title: Warner Bros. Reopens Talks as Paramount Signals Higher Bid
content.summary: Netflix, which Warner Bros. still described as its preferred bidder, has granted the board seven days to discuss Paramount’s most recent proposal, according to a statement Tuesday.  The decision came after a Paramount banker told a Warner Bros. board member that Paramount would offer at least $31 a share, or $1 a share higher than its previous offer, if the company agreed to reopen talks.

headline: Warner, Paramount Stocks Rally on News That Deal Talks Will Restart
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery said it would restart deal talks with Paramount Skydance—setting the stage for a potential bidding war between Paramount and preferred bidder Netflix.    Shares of both Warner (WBD) and Paramount (PSKY) rallied more than 3% in premarket trading.

content.title: Warner, Paramount Stocks Rally on News That Deal Talks Will Restart
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery said it would restart deal talks with Paramount Skydance—setting the stage for a potential bidding war between Paramount and preferred bidder Netflix.    Shares of both Warner (WBD) and Paramount (PSKY) rallied more than 3% in premarket trading.

headline: WBD Lets Paramount Add $1 and Then Takes It Off Read
summary: Netflix grants a seven-day waiver so Warner Bros. Discovery can entertain a slightly higher hostile bid, proving that in modern M&A, “best and final” is more of a suggestion than a number

content.title: WBD Lets Paramount Add $1 and Then Takes It Off Read

headline: Warner Bros reopens takeover talks with Paramount after receiving a waiver from Netflix
summary: Warner Bros. will reopen takeover talks with Paramount Skydance after receiving a seven-day waiver to do so from its preferred bidder, Netflix.  Warner Bros. said in a regulatory filing Tuesday that the waiver will allow it to discuss unresolved “deficiencies” in Paramount's previous offers.  Warner Bros. Discovery now has until Monday to negotiate a possible transaction with Paramount Skydance.

Discovery now has until Monday to negotiate a possible transaction with Paramount Skydance.

headline: Warner Bros rejects revised Paramount bid, but remains open to a final offer
summary: Warner Bros Discovery on Tuesday rejected Paramount Skydance's latest $30-a-share hostile bid, but gave the Hollywood studio seven days to come up with a "best and final" offer for the owner of HBO Max and the "Harry Potter" franchise.  Paramount informally broached an even higher per-share price of $31, Warner Bros said, apparently enticing the board to the table.  Paramount has until February 23 to make a new offer, which Netflix is allowed to match under the terms of the merger agreement, ‌Warner Bros said.
